intro: Plagiogyria elongata, commonly known as the elongated plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Plagiogyria elongata is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various insect species.
